sen.j: 覚信尼（かくしんに、元仁元年（1224年）- 弘安6年11月24日 (旧暦)（1283年12月14日）?）は、鎌倉時代浄土真宗の祖親鸞の末娘。
sen.e: Kakushinni (1224 - December 14, 1283 ?) was the youngest daughter of Shinran, the founder of Jodo-shin Sect who was active in the Kamakura Period.
Kakushinni (1224 - December 14, 1283 ?) was the youngest daughter of Shinran, the founder of Jodo-shin Sect who was active in the Kamakura Period.
Kakushinni (1224 - December 21, 1283?) was the youngest daughter of Shinran, the founder of Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) who was active in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。浄土真宗→Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) 用語統一リストよりperiod小文字にしました。

sen.e: Her mother was Eshinni.
Her mother was Eshinni.
Her mother was Eshinni.

sen.j: 俗称王御前（わうごぜん）。
sen.e: Her secular name was Wau-gozen.
Her secular name was Wau-gozen.
Her secular name was O Gozen.
She hailed from Hitachi Province.
She hailed from Hitachi Province.
She hailed from Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 久我通光の女房となって兵衛督局と呼ばれた。
sen.e: She served for Michiteru Kuga as nyobo (a court lady) and was called Hyoe no kami no tsubone.
She served for Michiteru Kuga as nyobo (a court lady) and was called Hyoe no kami no tsubone.
She served for Michiteru KUGA as nyobo (a court lady) and was called Hyoe no kami no tsubone.
sen.cmt: KUGA 大文字にしました。

sen.j: 日野広綱に嫁して覚恵・光玉尼を出産したが、広綱の没後、小野宮禅念と再婚して唯善を生んだ。
sen.e: She married Hirotsuna HINO and gave birth to Kakue ・ Kogyokuni, but after the death of Hirotsuna, she remarried Zennen ONOMIYA and gave birth to Yuizen.
She married Hirotsuna HINO and gave birth to Kakue ・ Kogyokuni, but after the death of Hirotsuna, she remarried Zennen ONOMIYA and gave birth to Yuizen.
She married Hirotsuna HINO and gave birth to Kakue and Kogyokuni, but after the death of Hirotsuna, she remarried Zennen ONOMIYA and gave birth to Yuizen.

sen.j: 父親鸞が帰京する際に母恵信尼に替わって上京して、親鸞の世話をすることになる。
sen.e: When Shinran returned to Kyoto, she followed him, in lieu of her mother Eshunni, in order to take care of Shinran.
When Shinran returned to Kyoto, she followed him, in lieu of her mother Eshunni, in order to take care of Shinran.
When Shinran returned to Kyoto, she followed him, in lieu of her mother Eshunni, in order to take care of Shinran.

sen.j: その後はずっと親鸞の布教を支えてきたため、親鸞没後は弟子達の布教に際してのまとめ役となった。
sen.e: As she supported Shinran's propagation activities throughout his life, she became, after Shinran's death, the organizer of propagation activities conducted by Shinran's disciples.

As she supported Shinran's propagation activities throughout his life, she became, after Shinran's death, the organizer of propagation activities conducted by Shinran's disciples.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: そのことが浄土真宗教団に繋がったと言える。
sen.e: It can be said that such activities by her led to the establishment of religious community of Jodo-shin Sect.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: It can be said that such activities by her led to the establishment of a religious community within theJodo-shin Sect.
It can be said that such activities by her led to the establishment of a religious community within the Jodo Shinshu sect.
sen.cmt: the Jodo Shinshu sect と訂正しました、スペース補足しました。

sen.j: 直弟子顕智らの協力を得て、京都東山大谷に廟堂を建立して、自らは留守職となって、本願寺の基礎を築いた。
sen.e: With the help of Kenchi, Shinran's direct disciple, she constructed a mausoleum at Kyoto Higashiyama Otani, assumed a position of Rusushiki and laid the foundation of Hongan-ji Temple.
With the help of Kenchi, Shinran's direct disciple, she constructed a mausoleum at Kyoto Higashiyama Otani, assumed a position of Rusushiki and laid the foundation of Hongan-ji Temple.

With the help of Kenchi, Shinran's direct disciple, she constructed a mausoleum at Higashiyama Otani of Kyoto, assumed a position of Rusushiki (custodian or caretaker of Shinran's Mausoleum at Otani) and laid the foundation of Hongan-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: at Higashiyama Otani of Kyoto,と訂正しました。(custodian or caretaker of Shinran's Mausoleum at Otani) 説明補足しました。
